Reviews.Title: “Great place for an overnight at the airport”
Reviews.Author: Charly T
Reviews.Content: We took the Cercanias train from downtown and should have taken the hotel shuttle from the airport to the hotel because it cost us 20 euros from Terminal 4 to the hotel. Some taxi drivers mix up the Axor Barajas and the Axor Feria, next-door to each other. Reception staff very nice. Beds very comfortable. Don't feel forced to eat in the restaurant. There was "light dinner" available from the bar (served on coffee tables). The best thing was to be able to print boarding passes from a printer in the lobby. The 5AM shuttle left almost exactly on time, and everyone got on. There were even some people who had arranged a 4:30AM shuttle for an early flight. Good comfort, good service, good price.

Reviews.Title: “Great overnight before flight home”
Reviews.Author: traviata136
Reviews.Content: The hotel is conveniently close to the airport, has a free shuttle (which we reserved when we checked in and the shuttle arrived exactly on time) and a nice breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “A great place for an overnight at Madrid airport”
Reviews.Author: Ellis M
Reviews.Content: We had a 15 hour layover and booked the Axor Barajas. We were coming from Africa (on the cheap) and wanted to splurge a bit on creature comforts before flying back to the US. This hotel turned out to be the perfect choice. Maybe it was just luck, but the airport shuttle arrived just 3 minutes after we arrived at the right spot. The room was spotless and high tech. We walked about 10 minutes to a huge mall where we had dinner at the food court on the top floor, but this was not just any food court. We selected a German restaurant with great service and food at a reasonable price. The stroll was pleasant. The next morning breakfast was exactly what we wanted and needed, and the shuttle back to the airport was efficient. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Dont rely on their shuttle”
Reviews.Author: LosAngelesTina
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel and had to wait for the shuttle for about 1.5 hours. The hotel clerk said there is a shuttle every 30 min but we did not see one at 11pm and we started waiting at 10:40. After 11:20 pm i went inside to call the hotel and when i hot out, my friend said the shuttle came but wouldnt wait even for a few min. For me to get back out from inside. We got desperate and wanted to then just take a taxi to this airport hotel but found out that it cost 30-40 euros to take the airport taxi to a 5 min away airport hotel because the Madrid airport taxi only go long distance. So we decided to wait for the shuttle again and finally the midnight one came on time. As we got to the hotel and complaint about the pickup.....as expected the clerk called the driver and the driver said he was there so I was offered a complaint form to fill out and to mail to the Madrid tourist board. Summary: axor bajaras hotel has bad shuttke service. Look for another hotel with more frequent shuttle run times and dibt take the Madrid airport taxi because they only run long distance.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice near airport”
Reviews.Author: metaligenics
Reviews.Content: Clean, modern, efficient. Large rooms, very comfortable bed, very large bathrooms. Restaurant with very good food was an unexpected bonus. Free shuttle to/from airport, just a few minutes away. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect family room.”
Reviews.Author: serendipity100
Reviews.Content: After reading other tripadvisor reviews, we had some "reservations" about reserving a room here, but found nothing to complain about. Incredibly clean and modern hotel. Desk spoke English. The Family room was so nice we didn't want to leave to see the city! Easily took the free shuttle from the airport to the hotel, and then used it to travel back to the airport to catch a city bus or metro to the city center. In the evening, returning via shuttle was a bit of a wait, and we were happy to have a cell phone along to continue to check on it. I like coffee maker in room, but I'll trade it for the plush decor with white leather sofas and clean white bedding any day! Our Grand-daughter felt so cozy in the drop down murphy bunk. Super clean, very quiet, nice staff, modern and nice hotel. Book your shuttle ride for morning airport at the front desk. Reservations are free, but required. Taxi queue nearby if you don't want to wait. No complaints. This is a good one.

Reviews.Title: “Shelter from the storm”
Reviews.Author: AlexCallaghan
Reviews.Content: There is nothing wrong with this hotel. It's clean and well-run, inexpensive and well-located within a few minutes drive to the airport. The restaurant is surprisingly good, and the shuttle works a treat. The rooms have well-stocked minibars and nice bathrooms. The people behind the desk (and in the restaurant) are friendly, efficient and hard-working. Even my wake-up call was on time. The only reason I have not given the hotels four stars is that...well, I think the place lacks a soul. There is nothing interesting or exciting about it. It's just a modern hotel with Ikea-style furnishings. Perfectly acceptable, and all that one should expect (or even hope for) from a hostelry whose clientele consists almost exclusively of guests who will be staying one night.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, spacious, beautiful and clean.”
Reviews.Author: familyoffourMA
Reviews.Content: Excellent choice for night near Barajas. Exciting modern design, spotless, spacious rooms and free shuttle. Family room exceptionally comfortable for two adults, and two teens.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel close to the airport”
Reviews.Author: 2132daisy
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Axor Barajas last week, before flying home the following morning. Contrary to some of the other reviews, we did not find the staff unfriendly, maybe because we were prepared to attempt at least a few words in Spanish, and as soon as we checked in were asked if we wanted to reserve seats on the airport transfer bus for the morning. The hotel was very modern and funky in its design and although we had planned to go straight to bed, we decided to spend a little time down in the bar and reception area, once we had seen it. This was a little on the chilly side, due to the large glass doors to the outside of the hotel, which kept opening, but this wasn't a major problem. There was free Wi-fi in this, and other areas of the hotel, and we were given the access code when we checked in. As for the accommodation, the bathroom and bedroom were extremely clean. There was a large walk in shower (no bath) and a wide variety of toiletries provided, including a toothbrush and toothpaste, shaving kit and comb, in addition to the usual shampoo and shower gel. We requested, and received a wake-up call, which was a 'real' person and not just an automated recording. We did not eat in the restaurant as we arrived late, and had an early start in the morning, although it looked very nice. The only point to consider, although it did not affect us, was that there were too many people waiting for the 5:30 am hotel transfer bus, and they all claimed to have reserved a seat. We were okay, because the driver went through the room numbers he had on his list, so perhaps some of the other guests had not actually confirmed their places, but I think they were trying to sort out alternative transport for those who could not fit on the bus. I would definitely stay here again as the price I got from booking online was very good value.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely and Modern!”
Reviews.Author: Twinzie
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel. It was super modern and very chic!! Brand new from the feel of it too and only about 15 minutes away from the airport which was great, because I was only here for one night due to a lay over! But the staff were amazing and the room was AWESOME! it was very very modern with a huge swivel flat screen tv, a mini bar, down comforter and a great couch sitting area. The bathroom and the shower were divine as well and the room had mood lighting which was a wonderful touch and an Ipod docking station. There were not many american channels but that was ok by me. I also ate in the restaurant and the food was very good. The receptionist area when you enter the hotel is super super swanky with great modern art deco type couches and chairs, with a bar to mingle after dinner! The location is not fantastic if you are in the mood for shopping there are definitely other centres in Madrid where you can stay for this but if you are looking for a place near the airport that is chic and modern you should definitely consider this place!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Airport Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Lauren M
Reviews.Content: This hotel my Mom booked for me to stay in when I got to Madrid because it was extra close to the airport. It offers a free shuttle service but I just took the 12 euro cab there and back. The hotel lobby is modernly designed and the floor I was on even had a Wii room for the kids. When I walked into my room I was shocked and thought they made a mistake. It was huge and I had a beautiful bathroom with a giant shower, leather couches, a big screen TV and a giant bed. We also got a giant free breakfast. I would recommend this to anyone who needs a place by the airport but other then that its not close to the city center. It also only cost 77 euros for this amazing suite like room!

Reviews.Title: “Convienient, Comfortable, Modern,”
Reviews.Author: hmurch
Reviews.Content: Axor Barajas Hotel is a clean and very comfortable stop close to the Madrid International Airport. It has a very modern decor and upscale accomodations at a value travelers appreciate. Free airport shuttle service was on time and efficient. The hotel restaurant was a surprise, with good menu items and tolerable pricing. Free internet service is available and, if you are not traveiling with a wireless device, the business center on the 2nd floor has a half-dozen laptop compuers at your service.

Reviews.Title: “Great airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: Joanna_Koltan
Reviews.Content: I satyed several times at Axor due to flights and it´s a good hotel for the price ( =60 €) and free shuttle service to the airport. There is free WIFI in the roon, just ask for the password and be aware that the shuttle is always on time! So: don´t be late! We always catch the shuttle bus @ the airport when we arrive and than again in the morning. Nice service and good design!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: jeskat1992_1991
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for a 2 day break to see a band in the Palacio de Deportes de la Comunidad de Madrid. The hotel is fab and we would definetly stay here again. It is close to the airport with a free shuttle services which comes every half an hour. The hotel itself is very modern and welcoming. It is spotlessly clean and the receptionists are extremely helpful. The only negative is that it is quite far our from the city centre so you are paying from about 17-20 euros in a taxi. There is a big shopping mall about 5 minutes away with places to eat, a supermarket and if you can believe it... Primark! ha If you are looking for a cheap but fabulous hotel, i would definetly reccomend this.

Reviews.Title: “Axor Barajas Hotel --luxury at a nice price.”
Reviews.Author: JamesP1942
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for our night to crash after traveling to Europe because it was close to the airport and looked good. I am very glad we did. The rooms were fairly luxurious, the beds comfortable, and the breakfast wonderful. The breakfast was pricey but very complete and worth every expensive cent to get us on our feet. The only problem we had was forgetting the handy shuttle to the airport, so when we arrived we got a cab who took us on a wild goose chase about three times the distance to the hotel. I hesitate to say the hotel was a bargain, because it was not cheap, especially the breakfast. But it was a very good value for the money and superb for the purpose of decompressing and getting some rest upon hitting the Continent.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, unusually good airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: AJD_CA
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night and were "upgraded" after booking a quad on Booking.com for 100 Euros. The room was truly gorgeous -- huge and beautifully decorated, with a nice bunk bed for the kids, flat screen TV, and very well appointed bathroom, with excellent modern appliances. We also ordered some small via room service (just salads and snacks) and it was all very well prepared. Good, strong Internet connection; good service; everything good. Bed was extremely comfortable and true king-size (wish I didn't have to get up for a 6:45 a.m. flight!). One last thing: we had booked the room with "Axor Feria," which is the sister property next door and were told at reception that our room was upgraded and to go next door to Axor Barajas. If this happens to you, do _not_ complain. The sister property is just literally next door and the rooms are terrific.

Reviews.Title: “A good airport hotel, but far from town”
Reviews.Author: T9-Orca
Reviews.Content: The hotel is clean, near the airport, modern and a good value. On the other hand, it's a long way from town, their restaurant is not a good value (for dinner -- breakfast is included with the room), and in general, there's not much to do but wait for your flight. The lounge area by the registration desk has a small bar, but bar food is limited to crackers until the restaurant opens. The restaurant doesn't open until 8:30 pm, which might make sense in downtown Madrid, but isn't great for folks catching morning flights. There were about 30-people at the door waiting for it to open the night we were there. You'd think they'd get the message, but apparently not. Nor does it open early for breakfast - not until 7:00. Again, a line of people waiting to get in, then rushing to get out in time for their 7:30 am shuttle to their flights. And folks with earlier flights had to do without breakfast -- and there were a lot of them. That said, even though the management doesn't understand their client's needs, it's a perfectly adequate hotel - inexpensive, with a comfortable bed, modern amenities, and quiet -- all right near the airport. On the other hand, there's nothing but the airport nearby, so don't expect to leave the hotel before you go to catch your flight.

Reviews.Title: “Nice design hotel close to the airport”
Reviews.Author: IL0veNature
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel when stuck in Madrid due to the ash cloud. The design of the hotel is very nice. Rooms very comfortable, good bed and bathroom. Food is also good quality, both at dinner and breakfast. Good variety and selection of wines. The reception is so so. Friendly enough, but they don't go out of their way easily. Internet connection is good. The shuttle service was very unreliable, you never knew when it would go. Convenient location close to the airport and Pleni Lunio shopping center.

Reviews.Title: “If you need to be near the airport, this is the pefect place”
Reviews.Author: saw4444
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my husband, my sister and her husband for one night in November 2011. We picked it because of its shuttle service and its location - it was our last night in Spain before flying out the next morning and we wanted to be close to the airport. For this purpose, it was great. The rooms were large, as were the bathrooms. The shower was very large and had great water pressure. The bed wasn't too hard and was actually a queen. (rather than two twin beds) This hotel also had a small workout room and room service.

Reviews.Title: “Great and super clean hotel near Madrid Intl Airport”
Reviews.Author: ULISSE12
Reviews.Content: Hotel shuttle very reliable and on time. Contact the hotel for the exact pick up area at barajas. Pay the extra 10euros to enjoy a truly great breakfast. Lots of hot items and cold cuts meats, fresh breads and many other delicious items. The hotel is only about 10/15 minutes away from International Airport. The area is very dead at night. There is a very large shopping center at a walking distance where you can find food and a drug store if needed. Getting into Madrid is super easy. Get the shuttle back to the airport and from there get on the super fast and clean Madrid metro. You will need to change once before actually getting downtown Madrid. The journey is about 30 minutes or so. Madrid, great city, great friendly people. Also, I want to say that the hotel staff is not overly friendly. Do not forget to bring your own wash cloths as they are unknown in Europe. My room was super clean and super modern. The bathroom was all in glass. Cool place.

Reviews.Title: “Very cool and affordable airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: mermaid86
Reviews.Content: The Axor Barajas offers spacious, high-tech rooms with "Jetson"-like decor, huge and comfortable beds, and wonderful rain-showers. For 65 Euro (not in peak season), I hated leaving the room for the airport. It's an excellent choice if you're flying out of Barajas airport or have business or some other reason to opt for lodging in the airport area. Wifi in our room worked well, and the hotel provided a printer downstairs for boarding passes, etc. Checking in and out were both easy, and the shuttle to the airport was prompt and hassle-free. Our dinner at the hotel wasn't inexpensive, but the meal was delicious and the service courteous. For general tourism purposes, it's a tougher sell. As other reviewers have mentioned, the hotel is in the middle of nowhere; you have to factor in the time, expense, and inconvenience of getting into Madrid and back each day. If having a great room at a bargain (for Europe) price is more important than having the city at your feet when you walk out of the front door, the Axor Barajas is well worth considering. We opted to stay downtown and chose the Axor Barajas only for the night before our scheduled departure (took a taxi from the train station after arriving from Barcelona). That was the right choice for us, but the Axor Barajas gave us a relaxing night at the end of our trip . . .and when our flight ended up cancelled after a long day of waiting around, and the airline arranged to lodge and feed all the passengers at a different "4-star" hotel near the airport, I wished I'd had the energy left to demand a voucher to return the the Axor Barajas instead.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, good service and good staff”
Reviews.Author: polarrrbear
Reviews.Content: We stayed here two nights, one night in early November and another night 11 days later. In both cases, we were very satisfied with the hotel. Check in was very quick and effortless, reception staff was very courteous and quick to check us in. It didn't take any more than a couple of minutes to get the key. The hotel itself is very nicely designed in a compact setting, nothing is confusing or difficult to reach. Be it restaurant, bar, reception, rooms, all are well laid out. Room was very spacious, perhaps largest rooms we stayed in in this price rage! It was a very nice to have 'living room' area of generous space without making sleeping part of the room crammed or otherwise small. Hotel's black and white color scheme and contemporary furnitures in the room did a good job giving modestly classy, yet still contemporary feeling. Two rooms we stayed in over two nights, rooms were very clean and similar layout, but the second room was little larger and a bit more spacious overall. For both rooms, bathroom was about the same size, also spacious (!) in both cases and of same design. They provide you with basic bathroom amenities like razor, toothbrush, shampoo, body soap and so on, which is nice (shampoo and body soap isn't bad actually. Don't make skin dry or hair coarse). I think the best part of the stay was the breakfast. I normally don't eat breakfast, but here, choice is large. Even as a vegetarian, I was happy to find quite variety of fresh sliced fruits to fill the stomach with. For non veggies, they should be able to find their favorite breakfast meats. That is, of course, aside from breakfast staples of bread, eggs, yogurt, etc. Good stuff. As for shuttle to the airport, DO ask about it when you check in. Otherwise you might not have a seat in the morning when you want to go. If anyone decide to take a taxi from the airport, for us, it was 20 euro the first time and 15 euro for the second time. Our place landed really late on both occasions, so we took a taxi on both nights. Not sure why the fare discrepancies. Not sure if we there was some thing going on with the road or we simply got ripped off. All in all, I highly recommend this hotel for a stop over. Price isn't bad, breakfast is good. If you can manage to catch the shuttle from the airport, this place is a wonderful value. Even if having to take a taxi, I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again if I ever need a place to stay around Madrid Barajas airport.

Reviews.Title: “Baron location, breakfast nice, everything else average”
Reviews.Author: neilyork
Reviews.Content: Axor Barajas On a recent visit to Madrid, I had a late arrival into Barajas airport and given this was my first trip to the city I thought Id stay out at the airport rather than risk public transport late at night that I was unfamiliar with (I needn't have worried as it turned out). Arriving at Barajas T4 I headed out to the courtesy bus stop and within a few minutes the small minibus arrived. It had just 8 seats and turned out woefully too small. Still, I barged to the front and got on-board. Soon enough we were full but had still to pick up at T1-2-3! So onwards we went and the driver had to explain to the T123 passengers that there was no more room. We then set off on what can only be described as the most frightening bus journey (or any journey) I have ever had. The driver drove like a real idiot and I felt scared - and I've seen bad driving in my time. On the final street to the hotel the driver thought it right to sit in a queue but because he was impatient, tried overtaking the queue - for no real reason. He was also flashing his lights at anything that got in his way, cornering like the minibus couldnt topple over and boy I was just glad to get off. Id have got a taxi had I know just how bad this driver was. So, having arrived at the hotel I found check in very slow. Despite them getting a third receptionist to come on duty, it just seemed to take ages. I reckon it took 20 minutes from arrival to getting my room key. Once in the room I found it nice, if a little baron from a view point perspective. The room itself was modern, large and everything worked. The wifi was very, very slow and I lost frequent skype calls back to my wife in the UK. I also found the air conditioning to be rubbish. I ended up sleeping with the window open. The following morning I took breakfast for a charge of €12 - in fairness it was very nice and offered a good choice of food. Overall then I would say this hotel was average. It isn't convenient for the airport or Madrid. The bus driver is miserable and reckless and check in took far too long. Wifi and air con in the room was not up to scratch. An average stay and not one to be repeated.

Reviews.Title: “Great Business Hotel at a reasonable price!”
Reviews.Author: RedSaphire
Reviews.Content: I stayed here the past week, the rooms are spacious, clean (it was cleaned daily) and the bathroom has a great double shower for reviving you after a long day at conferences. It doesn't seem that well known, so isn't overly crowded but is only 30Euros taxi ride from the airport, and is about 10 minutes from Feria De Madrid. Madrid itself is a taxi journey away and a beautiful city. The hotel also offers a free shuttle service to the airport or Feria de Madrid conference centre. There is a gym, not overly full of equipment, but is very useful with some cardio machines and free weights, it also has a sauna and jacuzzi so remember to take your swimming costume! I stayed here for 115euros a night room only, the breakfast was an additional 15 euros and was very nice, a mixture of cooked, and continental with sweet and savoury options. For the price I cannot fault it. The staff were friendly and helpful and spoke English, Spanish, French and Italian, quite possibly more. All rooms face away from the road so it is very quiet. There is a business centre and free WiFi available. If going to Madrid on business I would heartily recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “A fair good airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: BucharestSorinP
Reviews.Content: I choose this hotel as I was looking for the nearest hotel next the Auditorium Hotel - where the 2011 ISPOR Congress took part (over booked at that time). I found a very good hotel, with in accordance with the pictures on their site and at a reasonable price. Overall I was very pleased, the room was large, very clean, comfortable, silent. Just to think to anything less than very good I would mention that all the TV channels were in Spanish, minibar had only water and some drinks. There are no shops around, and a fair taxi fee to the center is around 25 Euro. If you intend to use public transport you have to take a bus nearby (5 minutes walk), to the first metro station (about 20 min) and than an other 20-30 minutes to the center (you might have to change the metro).

Reviews.Title: “Nice airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: El_Pollito_Loco
Reviews.Content: The Axor has very nice, spacious and modern rooms. To sleep is an excellent choice. The location is very good if you are staying around the airport. But there is nothing around the hotel, except a big shopping center where you can find a huge variety oh shops and restaurants. To go downtown, expect to pay around 20-25 euros for each way.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Airport Hotel, But Inconsistent Service”
Reviews.Author: L0ngIsland_familyguy
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Axor Barajas several times now. The facilities and guest rooms are generally very nice. The rooms are furnished in a very contemporary style. The beds are comfortable, rooms clean, bathrooms are large with an excellent shower. The restaurant is also a very good choice for both breakfast and dinner. This hotel really is an excellent choice for those needing to stay close to Barajas airport. However I have had a few experiences with poor service. The front desk is very inconsistent. I have had some very professional and accommodating staff help me with check-in, but I have also run into one of the worst front desk employees I have ever encountered. This last time in Oct. 2011, the front desk clerk could not find my reservation, and insisted that I had book their sister hotel next door (Axor Feiria). After schlepping myself and luggage over there, they told me that I was in fact booked at the Axor Barajas and called over to confirm that he had made a mistake. I returned and waited patiently for the same person to help me check-in. While I have no issues with an honest mistake, this clown made absolutely no attempt at an apology or even acknowledgement of his mistake for sending me away the first time. And then he acted like it was my fault since I pre-booked for the night before (a common practice when arriving on an early AM flight from the US), telling me they waited "all-day" for me and I did not show up. This type of behavior by a front desk person really demonstrates poor staff recruitement and training. It is a shame that in a country with +20% unemployment, hotels still get stuck with sub-par staff like this. It is also a shame because most of their other staff work very hard to provide good customer service. Readers should also be aware that their airport shuttle can be very inconsistent as well. After arriving at the airport bus area, I waited for an hour before the bus showed up. They advertise every 30 minutes. And while an extra 30 minutes is not really a big deal, it is a drag to sit on a bench and wait an hour after taking the overnight flight from the US. I would also caution anyone taking the shuttle back to the airport. While I have never attempted this, the shuttle from the hotel to the airport seemed extremely packed with dozens of people standing around with their luggage waiting for a ride. It seemed very chaotic and risky if you are on a tight schedule, so a taxi is probably a better option to avoid the stress. So would I recommend this hotel?...Sure, it is a good choice for a hotel near Barajas. But just beware the inconsistent service at the front desk and shuttle service.

Reviews.Title: “Nice airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: Swiss_business
Reviews.Content: Very modern and comfortable, only 15 minutes from airport, great price with very good breakfast buffet. Shuttle from airport was empty, but from the hotel a large amount of people waited every time, be patient. Service very neutral, but at €80 with breakfast for a large room one cannot complain!

Reviews.Title: “Communication lacking”
Reviews.Author: funtraveling2
Reviews.Content: Four of us recently spent a night here. We had booked the hotel & pre-paid through hotels.com. Needing a hotel close to the Madrid Barajas airport for a flight home the next day, we decided on the Axor Barajas for its location, price, & shuttle service from the airport (flew in from Porto, Portugal). The poor communication issue began after retrieving our baggage. We were told that the shuttle comes by every half hour, so we hustled to that area. After nearly an hour of waiting & needing to get to the hotel (we were quite tired from our 2+ weeks of traveling), we decided to take a taxi instead, a ride that cost 23.50 euros for a 2-3 mile trip. An exhorbitant amount, in my opinion! Since no taxi could accommodate all 4 of us & our luggage, our friends took a taxi as well & spent the same amount. We informed the desk clerk of our dilemma & asked why there was no shuttle. Her answer was, "Well, it should have been there." No apology, no offer of compensation, no empathy! The second incident of poor communication happened the next morning as we went to the breakfast buffet, which was part of our pre-paid package. We were told that the breakfast buffet was NOT part of our package. Only by returning to our room & retrieving the copy of our reservation with hotels.com that listed the breakfast buffet as part of our deal were we allowed to sit down & eat. By now the food wasn't tasting very good. The third incident happened shortly thereafter. Because of the problem with no shuttle the night before, we made sure we reserved a shuttle for 10:30 a.m. before retiring for the night & was assured that it would be there. I decided to double-check that at 10 a.m. The desk clerk succinctly said, "That is impossible, sir." By now I was starting to get a bit agitated & told him of the 2 aforementioned situations. He could see I was not going to accept his statement, so after a couple phone calls he said, "No problem, sir!" It came at 10:15. Other than these frustrations, the hotel did meet our expectations of a good location & a good price. If you're expecting more, you better double-check ALL communication with the hotel to avoid what we experienced.

Reviews.Title: “9.5 out of 10”
Reviews.Author: Asatis
Reviews.Content: Axor Barajas is one of the best airport hotels I've ever stayed in. The room we got was so spacious. Everything from the bed to the bathroom was great. Don't know what kind of shower head they use, all I knew is I didn't want to step out of the shower. Again, big bathroom. The small living area that comes with the room was certainly a nice touch The only reason I take a 0.5 off my experience is because a receptionist would not lend me an iron which is pretty odd. She said an iron is only available to be borrowed after 8 am. Are you kidding me? I even asked her twice to make sure what I was hearing was correct. This is the first time in my life being denied access to such a simple item. Hotels worldwide would lend such item anytime. Though they might tell you to return it in the morning but to be refused upfront is just strange. Aside from the iron situation, I will recomend this hotel and will stay here again if I'm back in Madrid. The room comfort was undeniable.

Reviews.Title: “great!”
Reviews.Author: Pam M
Reviews.Content: Hotel was clean and very comfortable. Very large room that easily slept 4 people. The bed was extremely comfortable. Very near airport with an airport shuttle. Market and mall close by. Desk staff friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap”
Reviews.Author: Adam S
Reviews.Content: Thought it was a great hotel for the price...new, clean, nice rooms, more than one channel in english on the tv. Would definitly stay here again for my last night in Madrid. Only bad things I could say about the hotel is that it is far from the city center and the breakfast buffet was not that great compared to other hotels that we stayed at.

Reviews.Title: “best of the airport hotels”
Reviews.Author: xolidot
Reviews.Content: Wow, after having stayed at the high tech hotel aeroport i wish i had persisted in getting a reservation at the Axor, it is reasonably priced, incredibly clean and modern and the room was so spacious, a bed (i had twin beds) a lounge area with a sofa and two single chairs (in white leather) adequately spaced and chiq, the flatscreen TV could be swivelled to face either the "lounge and bunkbed" side or the main bed side", there is a mini bar (which you can request to be cleared out) i did coz i had young boys with me whom i couldnt trust not to touch or move the bar stuff, as even movement/touch of the merchandise will register as used (touch sensitive). The bathroom very nice and huge hower, honestly i wished i had stayed here longer instead of the dump i spent so many nights at, if you want an airport hotethis is it, dont even consider the high tech!

Reviews.Title: “Good for business and airport - but could have been excellent”
Reviews.Author: DoctorFeelgoodDorset
Reviews.Content: The Axor Barajas is conveniently located for the Airport and IFEMA Exhibition Centre both 5-10min taxi or shuttle bus ride away (depends on time of day). It is a 4 star next to a sister 3 star Axor Feria Hotel. It has its own underground parking which is 15 Euros per day. Hotel is ultra modem and clean. Service was efficient but could have been more friendly. Food at breakfast and dinner was good but it’s a shame the dining area is in a rather stark black and white colour scheme and over lit in the evening. Service at breakfast was poor as although it’s a good buffet you have to clear and set your own table sometimes and await coffee. In contrast dinner service was almost too quick. There is a choice of wine by the glass - just house red or white which given 4 star rating is poor plus no sign of a proper wine list so a missed opportunity for the Hotel. Gim (sic), sauna and Jacuzzi in basement area between the two Hotels but its gloomy, un-attended and the Jacuzzi was not working so don't get your hopes up - basis facilities yes - resort spa its not! Rooms are very swish and well equipped albeit there are no ironing or hot drink facilities. Overall I would say it’s good for business and airport stopovers as it has a free daylight shuttle to the airport and most IFEMA events - but you must book. Not much good for sightseeing or tourism as 15-20 drive into Madrid and not near a Metro Station. 10 min walk to Pleniluno Shopping Centre.

Reviews.Title: “Design hotel near Madrid airport”
Reviews.Author: koneslon
Reviews.Content: I did not expect anything special from the airport hotel, but have to say that AXOR Barajas worth mentioning! First of all because you'll never expect such a stylish and convenient place for living. Receptionists speak English, rooms are clean and have some interesting amenities such as coffee machine, laptop PC. Design furniture and comfortable bed adds to the value. Room is spacious and convenient for living/working/relaxing. There is a big shopping mall MERCADONA just 7 minutes walk from the hotel. Go there and buy souvenirs/presents there. Madrid airport has a very shabby selection of shops and prices are unbelievable high, don't rely on last minute shopping. Coming back to hotel description I want to mention some minuses I experienced: 1) no slippers in the room 2) no sewing kit. reception searched for 5 minutes to bring me a needle and cotton. 3) iron and iron board can be ordered from housekeeping from 7am and still you have no guarantee you get them.

Reviews.Title: “airport hotel in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Loey2
Reviews.Content: very helpful english speakers at desk. Chic boutique white type hotel with large quiet rooms with wood floor. Great beds and pillows. Must be sure to find out which terminal your flight leaves from before you get there. Some shuttles only go to certain terminals. Must book shuttle in advance, as they fill up in the morning. We had our previous hotel call the Axor in advance and let them know our arrival time at the airport and the guy heading up the airport hotel busses at the airport told us we didn't have to call the hotel again to pick us up. I made sure that this hotel had a shuttle when booking it, but after waiting over 25 minutes for the hotel shuttle at 7 pm, we gave up and took a cab. Unfortunately it cost $25E, which = over $35. Perhaps one should figure out how to make a call in Spain and call the hotel upon arrival.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: jonathan9999
Reviews.Content: New, clean, value, good buffet. Easy access from Barajas. Free shuttle bus. Mini bar not included in price. Free wifi.

Reviews.Title: “Worst check in experience ever”
Reviews.Author: fantasia112
Reviews.Content: Probably the worst check in experience in my life traveling. The hotel prides itself with the excellent ratings it has from Tripadvisor (with very visible sign in reception area), I would only do it justice by posting the very bad customer experience I had with them on that same website. We arrived at the Feria around midnight (a hotel for which I had a booking made for a king size bed some 4 weeks ago) and waited patiently in line with only one receptionist attending guests. Two ladies were in the back office but not helping out (not even with the many phone calls). When it was our turn to check in, we learned that our room was at the nearby hotel (Axor Barajas). I wasn’t happy with the change as I had spotted major trouble when I got out of the shuttle. The hotel was visibly handling an “Emergency” or accommodating passengers from a cancelled flight. There were between 80 to 90 people in the large reception area. I have worked in the past in the hotel business and I know it is a very challenging situation. In the case of the Axor hotels it was completely out of control and to say handled “poorly” is a gross understatement. The gentleman helping me out at the Feria insisted that I would be fine, that he would make the check in himself and that I would only need to get my key from the other hotel. When we arrived there the understaffed personal was trying to cope with the many guests. I received my key but was yet to face the most outrageous part of my arrival. We arrived in a room that had 2 pieces of luggage in it. It was already 1.20 am and I didn’t want to have to (literally) fight for a room in an overbooked hotel. I called reception and asked them to take care of the luggage that was in the room I was assigned. Waited for 30 minutes but no one showed up. I also realized by then that the toilet had been used by the mysterious guest but nevertheless thought keeping the room was still the safest option. When I went down to ask who was going to take care of the bags, no one seemed to be aware of the situation! But I hadn’t paid attention to the name of the person who had been on the phone with me so I had to explain my story again. At that point a non uniformed gentleman behind the counter was begging a receptionist ending his shift to “stay a little longer”. I had a chance to interact with him some minutes later when heading back to my room, he was speechless when I briefly told him what I had experienced in only 2 hours. I was eventually in my room (free of a stranger’s luggage) at 2.20 am. I need to add to this review that: -we didn’t get the double bed requested 4 weeks prior when I made the booking. -never got our 9 am wake up phone call. -were not booked (as requested the night before) on the 11 am shuttle to the airport. I have been able to make positive reviews on two occasions for the AXOR hotels in Barajas, but this experience left me terribly disappointed. Airport hotels have to be functional, flying/traveling is already extremely stressful these days. No one needs to go through this type of experience. I will request a refund or a voucher for a future stay. Hopefully I will be able someday soon to report that the Axor hotels are still a good place to spend a night and rest. Will keep fellow readers posted.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: JayD2006
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel! Either you're staying in Madrid or getting ready for your flight, this is the most convenient and most elegant hotel I ever stayed at in Madrid. The hotel is clean and offer a variety of services. Beside the efficient and free airport shuttle, the bar, business center and the gym were excellent. In addition, the kids had great time in the Wii room, free of course. We booked a family room, which was of decent size; the beds were very comfy and the linen was so white, clean and soft. The bathroom was great with the latest fixtures in the market. The restaurant offered good food but a bit expensive and breakfast was not included in the room rate. Overall, I highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: djanni11
Reviews.Content: Just a one night stay as we needed to be close to the airport. This was a good choice. Excellent value for money. Clean, modern, quiet rooms. Free wi fi, and airport shuttle. Good breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Good Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bb_YOW
Reviews.Content: Free Hotel shuttle picked us up and a short ride to the hotel. We were put at the sister hotel (right beside it), not sure why, but it included breakfast. Room was very clean, but very basic. No extra blankets. Lots of TV channels. Water/coke and 2 beer in the mini bar. No staff at the reception desk in this hotel, only the main hotel next door. Only 1 bar of soap, but they would bring you more if you called. Good basic, clean airport hotel for a good rate. Nothing around it but businesses. We took the free shuttle back to the airport next morning and caught the metro into downtown Madrid. Staff were very helpful. Breakfast was basic, but was adequate for free. Not sure I would spend money on it though as there weren't a ton of choices for $10E.

Reviews.Title: “Nicesty”
Reviews.Author: xty314
Reviews.Content: Beautifully constructed hotel; very contemporary and chic but service was not so good for me as an African American female I did not feel welcome there, which was extremely disappointing as I was astatic to visit Madrid. The staff and natives made me very uncomfortable with their lack of hospitality.

Reviews.Title: “great overnight hotel for a stopover in madrid”
Reviews.Author: knight2
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel after seeing the reviews on trip advisor and was not disappointed, as a single female travelling on my own and needing an overnight stay in Madrid close to the airport, this was perfect, the shuttle picked me up from the airport without calling, and the room was gorgeous, the reception staff were helpful and courteous, and breakfast was good, all in all a perfect overnight hotel for my needs.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel in all ways”
Reviews.Author: MoroccanExplorer
Reviews.Content: clean confortable silent nicely decorated rooms 5 computers available 24/7 with internet shuttle from to airport huge mall 10 mn from hotel efficient and friendly staff excellent value for money

Reviews.Title: “awesome hotel”
Reviews.Author: bgrove
Reviews.Content: One of our favorite hotels on a two week trip in Europe. The modern decor was a nice change from the older, historic properties we stayed at on our trip. Family room was large and perfectly appointed for 2 adults and 2 teens. Wish this chain was in the U.S.!

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious hotel very conveniently located near the airport”
Reviews.Author: sjainuk
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very conveniently located near a shopping center and the airport. The shuttle service to the airport starts as early as 5:00 a.m., so its ideal if you have an early flight. There is ample parking available outside the hotel, so its quite cost effective if you are travelling with a car to Madrid. The rooms are very spacious and fully equipped. The internet service is free of charge. Overall very luxurious hotel and great value for money. It is worth noting though that every time you have to go to Madrid city, you would need to travel to the airport using the shuttle / taxi. There is no public transport in the vicinity of the hotel..

Reviews.Title: “What a delightful surprise!”
Reviews.Author: serendipity780
Reviews.Content: I was in Madriid for only 3 nights and had come from the overwhelm of staying inner city in Barcelona, so decided to stay close to the airport for an early flight direct to Costa Rica. The price was even better than the website indicated and so reasonable. The hotel is of a very high standard in a business park. Great restaurant, bar for coffee all foray & evening, wondrful room service, reception very friendly and helpful re going into the city by bus or taxi to nearby Metro, requests, etc. Safety box in the room, plasma tv, luxury bed and linen the biggest and best bathroom I have ever experienced, plus Wifi. Common rooms for Internet use, relaxation, tv, meetings, gym and spa. I was extremely happy with Axor.

Reviews.Title: “Inexpensive Hotel w/ very Modern Decor”
Reviews.Author: MaryKayLadyBug
Reviews.Content: Stayed just one night. Liked the free shuttle & wireless internet (why don't ALL hotels offer free WiFi - they have the means) and the breakfast. I was very cozy. View was not very good though...........

Reviews.Title: “Cheap, comfortable and modern hotel by the airport”
Reviews.Author: Mrandmsa
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great value for money but the location is a bit of a pain. We knew that before we booked but I think I'd rather be in town next time. In saying that, it's very easy to get to town if you want to use it as your Madrid base. You can catch the 77 bus to Canellajes Metro stop and then catch the number 5 line all the way to town for $2 per person. The only problem is that it takes 1-1.5 hrs. If you do want to do this I recommend you catch a taxi to the metro station ($6-$8) and then catch the train for $1 from there. This will save you a lot of time for only an extra $5. The hotel is very new and modern. The wifi worked in our room perfectly and was reliable. We had two large single beds though when we were expecting a king/queen so you may want to check that if it's important to you. We thought the breakfast wasn't worth the $30 for the 2 of us, but there's nothing close by either. The shuttle service to/from the airport worked well for us and the service from reception was average, but they spoke good English.

Reviews.Title: “Ruined vacation”
Reviews.Author: Vitaly_k4r
Reviews.Content: So that is my story: the hotel has a bus to/from airport. When we were going to the airport after our stay in the hotel, the bus driver lost our luggage! The bus has several stops in each terminal of Madrid airport. The driver dragged out our luggage at terminal 1 and left it on the pavement. So when I got off at my stop (terminal 2) - there was no luggage in the bus. Funny thing is that the driver did realise it was my luggage (she gave me instructions where and how to put it in the bus) and she did realise that my stop is terminal 2 (she asked it to organize all luggage in bus in order of stops). When I wondered where is my luggage - she just said, that it was in terminal 1. Funny? I was standing at the airport with my 9 month boy in hands with no luggage. She told me she will drive to the terminal 1 and get it. I waited 10 minutes.. 15... 30... (it was 3 minutes drive).. As you can guess she never returned.. I spent all my money on mobile phone (expensive roaming) to get a message from the hotel that she did returned to terminal 1 but there was no luggage on the pavement. Was it hard to look better? Or just enter terminal 1 and ask "Lost and found" if they have it? Or just use brains and not to leave luggage on the pavement in first place. And the most shocking - was the reaction of the hotel - not a single regret, no "sorry", no willing to help or solve the problem. They just turned off the phone and didnt speak to me. So I was at the beginning of my vacation, without my luggage and late for my flight. Thank you very much Axor Barajas - that was very nice of you!

Reviews.Title: “Great room”
Reviews.Author: suru
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night before catching a flight. The hotel is very modern, but very comfortable. Check in was easy and the staff very friendly. The large room had two twin beds pushed together and two bunk twin beds that were folded out of the wall. The bed was very comfortable. Nice bathroom with lots of amenities. It was very quiet and we slept well. The WiFi worked fine in the room and the if you e-mail your boarding passes to the front desk, the staff will print them for you. The free shuttle to the airport was on time, comfortable and very convenient. The only complaint was the restaurant, it was pricey and the food was below average. Other than that the room was great and the service excellent and the price very reasonable. I would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good but wi-fi is catastrophic”
Reviews.Author: IdaandKristof
Reviews.Content: Hotel situated few km from main Madrid airport. Located between other huge apartments, hotel and office buildings and close to the highway. I guess the purpose of this location is simple to take a night before or after your fly and it works. 10 minutes walk is a big commercial center - shopping mall Mercadona. What is good? - good quality of room comfort - bathroom, bed, window, space - it works good and first impression is very positive - location if airport is in your scope - underground parking (15€ per day) - reception staff with wonderful make-up (women) and shining brilliantine on black hair (men) - Clark Gable could take lesson What is bad? - reception desk works very slow (maybe too many? I was watched by 4)) - my booking was not in the system so I had to show my booking opening my e-mail (probably they did not know what room price I had agreed) what took few minutes - check-out the same - took not less than 5 minutes, very complicated - very few TV programs - there are many taxicabs near the hotel entry and taxi drivers offer you the lift or 'whatever you want'. It is disturbing procedure and hotel seems to be OK with this since drivers accost even in internal reception area :( What is very bad? - wi-fi internet works as a snail, very, very irritating Summary: Good and modern hotel with reasonable price (I paid 58 € per night) but not for people depended from internet connection. Be patient if contacting reception. I can imagine it can be suitable for budget travelers. They can stay here even few days - it looks like some buses can take you to the center of the town.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: City of San Marino, San Marino
Reviews.Title: “Perfect spanish hotel”
Reviews.Author: oscar5878
Reviews.Content: My friends and I , we stayed in two two-bedroom appartments. The appartments were very spacious and clean. Each of them had two bathrooms, fully-equipped kitchen and a living-room with the dinning table, sofa/bed and a large TV. The rooms were full of light as there were a lot of windows all around the appartment. The service was also very good. The reception guy helped us with directions, gave the map of madrid The only dissadvantages were that there was no free internet in room , but in the hotel downstairs was a computer with free wifi. The location is excellent. We really enjoyed staying in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great base for a city trip”
Reviews.Author: JacobJL
Reviews.Content: We stayed four night in this modern hotel. The hotel is a fantastic base for a city trip. When you want a hotel with a good price/quality value you need to stay here. The location is close to the airport, but when you want to go to the city center of Madrid. Just take the free shuttle bus that runs every half hour to the airport. And from there you take take the underground. Within 40 minutes you are in the middle of Madrid. When you finish you sightseeing or shopping. You take the underground back and shuttle. And you will find yourself in a really chic/trendy hotel. Which is located in a quit area, so you will get your needed night rest. The rooms are well appointed, and especially the shower is like heaven! You will have to fight with yourself to stop showering! The hotel also provide free Wii games, just ask at the reception for the controllers! There is also a dedicated place with free computers to use! And when you want you can even check in for your flight at the self-service-check-in desk. Wonderful! In the neighborhood you will find a big shopping center, with lot of (Spanish) shops! Also a big supermarket!

Reviews.Title: “Axor Barajas The best!”
Reviews.Author: justjill_21
Reviews.Content: One of the best hotels we stayed at in Madrid. Comparing to Westin and Roommate in town . We were upgraded to a business room, with internet and printer so we could print our boarding passes. Room was spotless, very high tech and super comfortable bed. Shower and Amenities very good. 3 blocks away is an Irish pub on same side of street (quick walk) and the mega mall was a 15 minute walk with a grocery, cineplex and large food court with International options. Warning-book hotel shuttle 15 minutes earlier than you need or else you will be waiting for late comers on "manana time" . That was not the hotels problem, it was the guests. Advice-Skip the gym and sauna! Not new enough, well equipped or or clean enough.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant overnight stop when flying from Madrid”
Reviews.Author: skt78
Reviews.Content: Huge bedroom and bathroom for an incredibly good price. Free pick up and return to the airport in hotel minibus. Restaurant and bar stay open late.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel for a night before a flight”
Reviews.Author: inmorocconow
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night between 2 flights that required an overnight stay. The hotel offers a free shuttle from the airport to the hotel and back again. It is supposed to run every 1/2 hour. The hotel is clean, modern, and spotlessly clean, but also very close to a shopping mall and transportation to downtown Madrid. Free internet is also provided and very much appreciated. Where you may be disappointed is that it does not have some of the quirkiness of pensions and other smaller hotels that you may stay at. However, after a couple of weeks of staying at nothing but, I found the modern sterility to be refreshing. You definitely will not regret spending the night here.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel for flying from Madrid airport”
Reviews.Author: Alexia
Reviews.Content: Very well organised hotel catering for travellers to and from Madrid aiport. Very modern with free wifi, wii area for kids (between 9 and 6), decent breakfast, long term car parking if needed and a free shuttle bus to the airport leaving every 30 mins but remember to book your seat on the bus in advance.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel for me”
Reviews.Author: Marcin737
Reviews.Content: The room was very big. It contained a big bed, a sofa, two armchairs, two chairs and a desk. The bathroom was also quite big and there was a huge shower. Everything was very nice, new and modern. There were both wired and wireless Internet available for free. The whole hotel was decorated in a really modern way. In the public part of the hotel there was a TV room, Wii zone and a chill-out zone. The breakfast was very good and there was a plenty of food to choose from. The hotel provided with a free transfer to/from the airport. The shuttle bus was available between 6AM and 12AM. It was collecting people from every terminal (probably starting from Terminal 4). It run every half an hour.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Place”
Reviews.Author: StChristopher66
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night prior to flight the next day. Hotel is only a year old so was in great shape. Very modern decor. Room was good size by European standards. Great bathroom, only issue is that the door to the bathroom is a frosted glass door that does not lock, so kind of a weird feeling at first when you are used to a locking door at home and most hotels. Other than that, great bathroom easy to use. The bed was very comfortable and a true king matress, not two singles pushed together. We ordered room service at 11:45pm and it was there within 10 minutes (the kitchen closes at midnight). We had several hamburgers and my wife (a foodie) and kids loved them. I was surprised for a hotel. I usually don't like room service because by the time it gets there, it is luke warm and mushy. This was not. We ate breakfast at the hotel. The kids ate free, so it made it reasonable. There was a great selection and everyone was satisfied. The front desk staff was very friendly, spoke English and was helpful. We had a rental car and paid 15 euro to park overnight. (They have a shuttle to the airport, but did not use it so can not comment on it.) My only complaint was that, like all the hotels in that area-Hilton, etc., is that they are somewhat difficult to get to if you don't have an excellent map of that specific area. There are not many exits off of the freeway, and if you miss the one, you have to drive around for another 20 minutes to get back to it. This hotel is well worth it though, just bring a good map if you are driving to it. On the way out, there was no trouble getting to the airport, a 10-15 minute drive. Easy rental car return. We would stay again. The whole family loved it and dad was a hero on the last night of our trip.

Reviews.Title: “great value”
Reviews.Author: piboBelgium
Reviews.Content: Stayed just one night because I had a 8 hours lay-over over night. I found the quality of the rooms and facilities amazing for the price I paid (+/-50 EUR/night!). I did not use room service nor the airport shuttle (arrived too late and preferred to take taxi to airport) so I cannot comment on that. I did not find the front desk person to be very helpfull but can emagine that service may be better during the day then at night. I would definately recommend this hotel without any hesitation to anyone who needs to catch an early flight.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Hotel; Horrible Service”
Reviews.Author: MikeyMaine
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised by the appearance of the hotel and the rooms during an overnight stay between flights. However, the service (or lack thereof) make this hotel worth avoiding at all costs. Between the airport pick-up, the check-in, the room service and the check-out, I only ran into poor service. Most notably, my room service was freezing cold (not even a touch warm) and when I mentioned this to the room service person after receipt, they simply said they were too busy to get me anything else. In addition, when I advised the front desk at check out, he merely smiled and laughed. I'd avoid this hotel if you actually want to be treated as a respected guest.

Reviews.Title: “I will return, well worth the price!”
Reviews.Author: bobbiot
Reviews.Content: It's hard trusting the internet to select a hotel, especially for one night's stay when having to stay by an airport. But the Axor stood up to the test as it is very close to the airport, has free shuttle, and is modest when you consider how upscale the hotel is. It has a euro design with leather couches, wood floors, towel warmer, indirect lighting and is very inviting. I recommend you spend the extra euros and purchase the breakfast buffet as it is well worth it. There is a mini bar in the room, but I recommend you bring your own soda or water from the airport if you want something upon check-in as there is nothing available close by. Free wifi. I highly recommend this hotel as it is worth every cent.

Reviews.Title: “Price/Quality this is a fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: RCGenk
Reviews.Content: After driving from Valencia to Madrid, we ended up staying at Axor Barajas in Madrid (near the airport). Next door is Axor Feria (associated) to which I cannot comment. After coming from Ayre Astoria in Valencia, Axor was a breath of fresh air. Modern, large rooms that look sleek. Everything was as one would expect or better. Nothing of interest nearby (except for the airport and a relatively large mall) but we had a rental car so we didn't care much. Drive "downtown" (Royal Palace) took about 25 minutes by car. Great hotel, good experience. I would certainly return here.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but no warmth, AND AIR CON!!”
Reviews.Author: lark830
Reviews.Content: I am currently staying at this hotel. When I booked it online, I thought it looked like my style of hotel. I'm more partial to contemporary design hotels. Once I arrived though, I noticed that the design has a negative aspect, which is there is no warmth in the hotel. Everything is nicely designed, almost sterile and clinical, yet there is nothing to warm the place up. No pictures on the wall in my large room, no plants, no anything. In addition, I found the people at the front desk to be almost the worst I've dealt with. I've been here 5 days, and I've gotten NOT ONE smile, or felt that they would do anything to help me. They are very cold, almost like they don't like to be bothered with what they are doing to attend to the guests. My biggest complaint, which would make me never stay here again is the fact that they have air conditioning in everything room YET it doesn't work til after the sun sets! What's up with that? I went down and ask the front desk twice about not having air con in my room, and only the fan is working. They promised twice that someone would come up and fix it. No one EVER came. Then, later that night I noticed it came on. After that incident I had a suspicion that they are trying to save on electricity costs by making them kick on at night, so i started writing down the times when I heard it kick on, and it was after sunset each night! I'm sitting here now at 1:40pm trying again to turn it on, and it won't switch on! I am on my way to the front desk to complain again about it. If you want to have the same problems, by all means stay here. I personally have a problem with a hotel that I spend over $500 telling me when I can and can't use the air conditioning in my room.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel but too hot in summer”
Reviews.Author: Mark_O_M_London
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel due to its close proximity to the airport (10 minutes drive) and Pleniluno shopping mall (15 minutes walk). I landed at 11:00 and wasn't picking up my hire car until 18:00 so I didn't want to go too deep into Madrid and wanted to be able to walk to the mall so that we could have lunch and entertainment for the children. Due to our stay being in August Madrid was not busy and so we were the only passengers on the hotel's coutersy bus. Arriving at the hotel we were not greeted by smiles from the reception ladies however they were extremely professional and were smiling as we made our way to our rooms. The family room we chose was perfect, two bunk beds and a large queen size bed and the bathroom was large and very modern. The only negative was the lack of aircon and given that we were in Madrid in August the nights were rather uncomfortable. Breakfast was first rate with a choice to satisfy even the fussiest of guests. Last point, do not rush to use the hotel car park. we found sufficient parking on the side streets. Overall thisis a hotel I will not hesistate to use again even during the height of summer.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: Priths
Reviews.Content: Really big comfortable rooms, even with a family of four. Was a relief after the tiny "family" rooms more common in Europe. Trendy high-tech look. Decent airport connectivity. It is an airport hotel in a business park, so it clearly is not meant to have local flavour or be atmospheric. There is a biggish shopping mall within walking distance that kept the kids amused on a rainy afternoon. Service and food were acceptable, despite the hotel being chock full of stranded passengers. Amazing value for money at ~ 75 euros per night.

Reviews.Title: “Probably the best quality/price relation in the Barajas area”
Reviews.Author: joabla
Reviews.Content: I have been to quite a few hotels around Barajas airport in Madrid, and I would say, by large, Axor Barajas is the best. New, modern, clean, neat, a great hotel. There is a free shuttle, but just from 5 to 23, so bare this is mind if your flight arrives late and you could have some delays. The WiFi is free and GOOD. Decoration is great, very modern. Rooms are really comfortable and new. Plus on each floor there is a large room dedicated to different entertainments: computer room, Wii room, business room, news room and chill out room. Unfortunately, the only con is the staff at front desk, not really too friendly and much worse than the great hotel where they work. If you don’t want to pay for the breakfast at the hotel (15 euros), there is a cafeteria at the nearby Makro center where 2-3 euros will be enough for a latte and a small sandwich. There is a bus stop 250 meters away were you catch a bus that takes you to a metro station from which you can get straight into downtown, if you happen to have time for a quick excursion.

Reviews.Title: “Very poor service, clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: maklijn
Reviews.Content: -Check-in was very slow and erratic (3 times the wrong keycard..) -The free shuttle bus left while we were in the queue for checkout, we made a reservation! -the rooms were spacious and clean -the roomservice was quick, but the food poor.

Reviews.Title: “Does the job”
Reviews.Author: spirite
Reviews.Content: A smart, modern hotel. Very convenient for Madrid airport, less convenient for Madrid. The family room is amazing - huge with bunk beds and a seating area. Free wii area for the kids. Free shuttle to/from the airport worked perfectly. Short walk to a good mall with plenty of food choice/supermarket. Only downside was getting to/from Madrid - short walk to no 77 bus (1€). 10 minute journey to Canillejas (?) metro station (1€), 30 minute ride into the Centro. Takes at least 45 minutes. No problem to do journey in and out once a day, but no good if you want to pop back to the hotel for a siesta! Have a nap in the Retiro park instead.

Reviews.Title: “Stinking air conditioning! Could not sleep.”
Reviews.Author: GranCanariaDave
Reviews.Content: Booked a family room for my family (2 adults, 1 child age 4 and baby aged 1) for a one night on the 10th July as a stop airport over after a terrific week in Malta. The position of the hotel is only good for an airport stopover or a base to travel into the centre and around Madrid; nothing else but we knew this. We paid 105 Euro for the night without breakfast and whilst this is not cheap, it is also not expensive. The staff at the hotel were very good and the hotel appearence itself was as good as the reviews on Trip Advisor and we were initially happy with the choice we had made. The problems started...we put the kids to bed and due to the July humidity in Madrid, we turned on the A/C so they/we could sleep. After about 30 minutes, an awful smell of came along and I am not able to put my finger onto what the smell actually was other than a dead festering animal. This became worse to the point that it was getting in our throats...it was awful to say the least! I quickly dressed and approached the members of staff on the reception politely explaining my concern. A youngish chap on reception quickly explained that they were aware of this but there was nothing they could do as it was coming along from a factory just behind the hotel. I headed back to my room and met an american gent who came out of his room and was equally concerned as me. I explained the factory story to him. In re-entering my room, the smell was absolutely foul so at that stage I re-approached the reception and asked a different member of staff to follow me to my room explaining the smell was unbearable. He explained that he has children and was again, a polite fella. He could speak fairly good English and on opening the door to my room, he quickly turned around saying that that it was too much and we needed a different room immediately. He then explained that he thought there was a dead animal in the A/C system and it had happened before...different story to the last one. He was very helpful in transferring my kids and the necessary to another room (1am). I was relieved to move rooms and began to fall asleep before the smell came along once more....I could not believe it and at this point decided to turn off the A/C rather than risk our health; much to my wife's dismay. We never got a goods nights sleep hereon due to the heat of Madrid. All my family suffered the following day due to tiredness and I should have made a fuss on checking out but I do not feel comfortable in doing this and so we just left. It is only on arriving home I feel that I should warn people especially as a friend of mine explained that legionaire's disease can be caught through A/C systems. I will certainly not recommend this hotel solely on the A/C failings. The manager knew what happened and i feel that he should have done something to make us feel a little happier. I got the feeling that the management are willing to accept complaints from a large and consistent flow of guests and that they are willing to accept this as they will always remain busy...Not good at all and still not happy. Room 441.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel and great food in the resturant!”
Reviews.Author: zen04
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel only because of a special that travel zoo was running and it happened to be in the location we needed. What a pleasant surprise! We had to leave early because of our flight and was unable to take advantage of the breakfast that was included with the deal however the front desk said we could take a brown bag lunch to go so we had something to eat before our flight. I would highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with exceptional value”
Reviews.Author: smacIL
Reviews.Content: The hotel is great, with a contemporary decor and exceptional staff and facilities that were well beyond expectaions given the price of the room. I'd recommend it to anyone needing an airport hotel for both convenience and savings.

Reviews.Title: “Possibly the best option for a stopover”
Reviews.Author: wander5r
Reviews.Content: Very well located near the Madrid airport, excellent for a stopover. There is a free shuttle running frequently for the most of the day. Rooms and bathrooms are spacious and have a "postmodern" design. My room was very quiet, in spite of the close distance to the airport. Breakfast was good, even had freshly squeezed orange juice! But I can't give "excellent" because service staff at breakfast was very unfriendly and inefficient. Tea/coffee is not offered at open access - you have to order them, and it takes over 10 minutes for them to bring it, although the restaurant was almost empty. They just ignore you when you try to complain. Also, omelette was completely cold.

Reviews.Title: “Great value!”
Reviews.Author: EdgarSGuatemala
Reviews.Content: I booked Axor barajas based on two premises: tripadvisor reviews and price. I had an excellent stay. The room was spacious, the bathroom was great. I was not expecting what we got. You can walk about two blocks and get a bus to the Metro. The only complain was that we had to wait about 45 minutes for the suttle to arrive. Not easy when you just had a 10 hours flight.

Reviews.Title: “Funkadelic perfection!”
Reviews.Author: jw6969
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel because it looked pretty near the IFEMA convention centre. It isn't - it's a €12 taxi ride although the hotel shuttle bus goes there on request. In fact the bad bit first - its location is pretty grim. But that's about it - everything else was great and there were plenty of nice surprises - how often does that happen - never! Once inside the hotel, the entrance lobby rises four or five stories. Staright forward and pleasant check-in. Small bar serves enormous gin and tonics. The room was fabulous - huge. Wood floors and funky minimalist approach. The bed was a super king and really comfy - I had a great nights sleep. Even the pillows were great which is rare in hotels. The work table had a laptop on it! The wireless connection on my pc was fast, but on the hotels pc it was poor. Well stocked minibar and at reasonable prices (beer €3, cava €6). On top of it was superb coffee maker. Double sofa and two single chairs, 32 inch TV. Wardrobe had a safe big enough for my pc. Bathroom is actually a shower room. The shower was excellent, with good pressure. usual amenities provided. A/C worked well. Black-out curtains good. I paid €100 a night which included breakfast (also v.good with fresh orange juice). I used the restaurant one night with a friend. We had a superb meal - starters of prawns, fois gras and something else, followed by steak and chips wshed down with two bottles of wine. Bill €125. Service was slightly grumpy. Overall I would recommend this hotel if using IFEMA or the airport. It is quite a long way from central Madrid. I will certainly return.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel: clean, modern, spacious and helpful staff!”
Reviews.Author: ag8
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel for a visit to Madrid to see Real Madrid play and generally do abit of sightseeing. Hotel Pros: - Exceptional room size and quality - One of the cleanest hotels I have ever visited - Modern minimalistic styling throughout - Hotel staff conversed in English and were helpful - Can get a bus to Metro line from end of Hotel street - Free shuttle bus to and from Barajas airport every 30 minutes Hotel Cons: - Distance from city centre is substantial, 5 minutes walk to bus stop, 10 minutes bus to metro, 15 mins metro to city centre BUT public transport is exceptionally efficient and affordable. Overall: a clean, modern, spacious hotel close to Barajas airport and exceptional value for money. Helpful staff treated tourists very well despite our lack of Spanish, and public transport to city centre was convenient enough not to trouble us.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: ArnaldoJet
Reviews.Content: I’m a brazilian airline pilot flying all around the world for flight simulator recurrent, leisure or just work. This time is Madrid. Everything was perfect except for two minor problems. The hotel bus (airport to hotel) delay 45 minutes (ok, it was due to volcanic eruption in Iceland and hotel was full!!!) and the in room minibar that don’t give you the choice of bring your own beverage or food (for me that stayed for 10 days it’s a little bit important) cause if you take out anything from it, it is automatically charged. But let’s talk about what is really important, this hotel is amazing, ones of the best I have ever been!!! Beginning from the front desk, two kindly receptionist receive us with a beautiful smile. She gave me a magnific room, believe or not there were a notebook connected to wireless internet and a nespresso coffeemaker inside my room!!! The room is quite and very clean, 32 hdtv, in room electronic safe and a smooth king bed. The bath room is large and with heater inside. There are a gym with sauna and Jacuzzi. In the vicinity there are a mall, with lots of restaurants inside. I recommend this hotel at all.

Reviews.Title: “Great style but lacking some substance”
Reviews.Author: Martin_Tenerife
Reviews.Content: We came to this hotel as a one night stopoff on our way home during the Volcano crises in April 2010. The hotel is full of stuck travellers. The good points: * Great location for the airport * Amazing looking rooms. You walk in and go 'WOW'. Huge room. Great bathroom. Big TV. * Huge, comfortable bed. * Great value for this quality of hotel. Paid EUR €95 for a double room. Last night I stayed in a flea pit in Rome and it cost EUR €75, and this was 1000 times better. * There's a huge shopping centre around the corner. tons of shops. tons of restaurants. cinema (in Spanish). * Free WiFi. There's a computer room with free access to laptops. * Blackout blinds on windows (though they're not 100%). There are no blinking lights or LEDs in the room so it's pretty dark. * Lots of the reviews complain about bad service, but everything's been fine for us and everyone speaks perfect English. Maybe they read the reveiws and improved! The bad points: * On an industrial estate, so no character and no views * Our room was all white, which while looking great from a distance, shows the wear and tear close up. * The Internet connection was very, very slow. The hotel is pretty full so this may explain it, but if I were on business this would be unusable. * The shuttle bus (whilst free) only runs once per hour and only takes 19 people. If it's full up you get to wait another hour or have to pay for a taxi. * The air conditioning isn't working throughout the whole hotel. our room is baking hot. * I wish 'designers' weren't allowed near bathrooms. The bathroom door is glass, so when you go in the night the bathroom light lights the bedroom. There's no lock on the door. The sink looks amazing but takes about a teaspoonful of water before overflowing. If it weren't for the air conditioning I'd give this a 4.5. But not having working air conditioning made for an uncomfortably hot night, so it only gets 2.5. I don't see any other reviews complaining about this, so it may be a one-off.

Reviews.Title: “Good”
Reviews.Author: VLSM
Reviews.Content: Good hotel, clean, good price/quality relation, We stayed in a junior suite because of the children. they had a wii room without wii´s (!!!!) But overal its a good choice and it offers a excelent price. The only thing i didnt like its the unfriendly staff in the chick in and information desk. Very cold, without any simpathy, Thats why i dont rate this hotel at the maximum level

Reviews.Title: “Best choice near the airport!!! Great new hotel”
Reviews.Author: vastravel
Reviews.Content: Modern, clean, nice , spacious, great shuttle service!! Everything great!

Reviews.Title: “Spacious modern comfort”
Reviews.Author: WorldTraveler9
Reviews.Content: The free hotel shuttle picked us up at the airport and drove us straight to the hotel. The distance to the hotel is a bit farther than I expected. Arriving at the hotel at noon, the staff was quite busy and could not find our room, so we left our luggage to head to Madrid for the afternoon. When we returned at 5 P.M., our room was ready. Instead of the word "room", I should say "suite". The L-shaped room included a very spacious living room with a long desk that separated the living room from the bedroom.
