On the desk was a large flat-screen TV that could be rotated 180 degrees if you wanted to watch it in bed. The bathroom was beautiful and sparkling clean, around the corner from the bedroom, just inside the front door. My only complaint about the room is that the bathroom had a glass door with wide gaps around the edges. I hung one of the large towels over the door. The hotel is quite a distance from the nearest Metro station, a 10 Euro cab ride. The easiest way to catch the Metro is to take the shuttle back to the airport. The Metro stations in the airport are very convenient, and the fare is only 2 Euros (1 Euro plus ! Euro airport surcharge).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent facility, but not very helpful”
Reviews.Author: canarytraveler
Reviews.Content: My young daughter and I stayed at this hotel on mandatory layover on the way to Paris. I picked it because of the very reasonable price and proximity to the airport. We used shuttle to get to the hotel and back to the airport and each time did not wait longer that 10 minutes. The ride itself is under 10 minutes. The hotel is very modern and comfortable, beds and pillows are excellent (too bad we had an early flight). The reception was helpful in getting a taxi for us to see the Madrid center which worked out great. However, when we tried to use a few items from the minibar, we found out that almost all beverages require a bottle opener. There was none in the room, the bar was closed and the reception told me they ran out of bottle openers. They absolutley refused to help me with this which really surprised me that they were so unwilling to sell a bunch of overpriced drinks :) Other than that, it's an excellent hotel and I would definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of the shuttle”
Reviews.Author: gorka
Reviews.Content: I missed a flight connection and Lufthansa paid for this hotel so I do not know the price. I very nice airport hotel but beware of the suttle because , although they say that the shuttle goes to the airport every 30 minutes, I had to wait for fifty minutes and because it is just for 19 people , when the shuttle arrived there was not space for me so I had to take a taxi ( 20€) to Terminal 4 in Madrid Barajas airport....

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Claris22
Reviews.Content: The Axor Barajas was amazing, I absolutely loved this hotel, what a great surprise! It was our last night in Madrid and wanted to stay by the airport and I am so glad we did. The service was amazing, the room incredibly modern, new and clean and very spacious. The free internet and airport shuttle were a nice touch to, would definitely stay again. Highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, new hotel, but...”
Reviews.Author: kresju
Reviews.Content: I have impression they will struggle to sustain value level... Dont get me wrong- so far the hotel is gorgeous but there are some things which are not working as good as they should... I mean mainly the building where the gym, sauna and jacuzzi are for the disposal of guests... it should be closed for reconstruction/renovation due to fungus showing up on the ceiling...what a pity that the architect forgot about proper ventilation in this totally new building... not the fault of management but they should consider closing it because when i saw it, the whole very positive experience about this hotel evolved and i felt quite disturbed that such thing is possible in a 4* hotel - it should be for sure out of visitors sight! Not to mention the fact that when you pay a certain amount of money for the hotel, you expect its services to be available... I want to express though that apart from the unfortunate gym facility I would consider most of other services or facilities to work quite good

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful exterior, but this trait does not does extend to the important things like service, food and friendliness.”
Reviews.Author: MikeHutch
Reviews.Content: While Spain is not known for its customer service skills, the staff at the Axor set a new bar on how low it can be, getting to the point of being outright rude. More so, none of the staff even processed anything beyond rudimentary English, considering its proximity to a Hub airport like Madrid, this was unexpected. While the room cost is reasonable, the restaurant is overpriced to the point of absurdity. i.e. 20 Euro for a few pieces of undercooked beef (apparently it a “T-bone”), 10 euro for a few stalks of asparagus. Even more, they were unable to make any sort of concessions for a vegetarian. The dishes eventually served would embarrass the staff of other restaurants. The close location to the airport means dining inside is one of the few feasible options, and therefore its poor performance should play a large factor in your decision to come here. The clichéd expression "beauty is only skin deep" applies well to the Axor. The rooms and hotel are chic and trendy, but anything beyond the surface leaves one disappointed and frustrated. Spending our last night unfortunately has tainted the memory of our whole Spain/Portugal trip. Please learn from our mistake.

Reviews.Title: “Superb new hotel”
Reviews.Author: PK173
Reviews.Content: Before I launch into my review, I will state that my ratings depend on how a hotel compares to my expectations. A hotel can only achieve a maximum rating from me if it exceeds my expectations. If I stayed in a super posh 6* hotel with price to match, it would be very hard for it to achieve a max rating, because I would surely judge it as stringently as it's room rate suggests it is good. I obtained a very competitive rate for the Axor Baraxas - comparable to the rate of a low budget, low comfort hotel in the UK. The Axor Hotel actually consists of 2 hotels: the Barajas - a 4* business hotel - and the Feria - a 3* budget hotel. To be clear, this review is about the Axor Barajas. The location is very convenient for the Airport and the Feria de Madrid exhibition centre. There is a complementary shuttle which serves both the airport and the Feria. If you can't wait for the shuttle at the airport, be aware that jumping in a taxi will cause the driver to snort in disgust at the the low far this will attract, even if it is nearly €20. Avoid airport taxis if you can! As for getting about from the hotel - there are often taxis lurking outside. A cab to the centre of Madrid will cost you about €20. If you jump in a waiting cab, the meter starts when you jump in. If you ask the desk to call a taxi for you, the meter starts when it starts the journey to the hotel. Be aware of this or you may think the taxi is ripping you off - it isn't, that's how it works here. And so to the hotel. The front office staff are attentive and effective. After a swift check in one of three lifts will whisk you to your floor. The rooms are large and comfortable. I stayed in an executive room which was very well equipped. It had a table with 4 chairs, as well as a desk, so this would be an ideal place to hold a business meeting or to have room to spread out if you have lots of paperwork. The king sized bed was very comfortable, too. The bathroom has a great walk in shower and a soft closing toilet seat - both indicative of the attention to detail in this establishment. Each floor has a feature room - an ad hoc meeting room, a news room (papers and CNN for example), a computer room, a games room... Internet connectivity is free and is wired or WiFi in the rooms and WiFi in the public areas. The one negative aspect of my stay here was with the restaurant. The service did not meet the high standard that the rest of the hotel had led me to expect. The breakfast buffet was similarly unappetising. Having said that, for the rate paid, it was a spectacular success. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Wow !!!”
Reviews.Author: maranelloLondon
Reviews.Content: Ok, I am in the hotel business and am not easily impressed but this new hotel ticked every box for me ! The design is amazing ! Just sit in the lounge and see lots of people taking pictures of it ! The staff service is very good, clearly well trained. The rooms are large, funky and very very clean. The car parking is on site and easy to access The only fault I have is that the dining room is characterless, however the snacks are great ! Its pointless writing much more because in all honesty its a hotel that I can 100% recommend. I suspect rates will rocket as its popularity increases

Reviews.Title: “Brand new & excellent value close to Madrid airport”
Reviews.Author: travelerww
Reviews.Content: According to the assistant manager, this hotel just opened September 1, 2009. It has very modern & bright decor, and everything looks and smells new! Its location close to Madrid's Barajas airport along with free transport provided on their new mini buses departing every half hour were deciding factors in giving this hotel a try. The entry and lobby is very spacious with a parking garage below level. Three large elevators are available. Staff was friendly & check in was swift. Our room was comfortable with good individual climate control. There is a refrigerator containing refreshments. The shower stall in the bathroom is extra large! The cyber-room available to guests did not yet have the free internet accessable computers set up, but the hotel manager let me use his computer to access the internet from his office. Said he has received the cyber room equipment which should be set up in about a week. We did not try out the free wifi said to be accessable from our room. Did not have a chance to try out their spa/exercise center. The hot breakfast buffet had a wide variety of offerings and is located in a large dining room. The trip to terminal T1 at the airport took about 10 minutes. They also offered free transport to the Convention Center. Total price for the double was 69 euros, breakfast included. Cab fare to the hotel from the Renfe Chamartin train station was 18 euros.

HotelInfo.Name: Axor Barajas Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Calle Campezo 4, 28022 Madrid, Spain
